sub_title: Risk and Strategy Executive; Non Executive Director
summary:
I am a strategic, collaborative and results driven leader with over 10 years in executive management positions within the financial services sector. As an expert in leading strategy and risk management programs within a large, highly regulated and corporate environment, I have been a key driver in leading structural improvements, information gathering and decision making, managing risk strategy and building empowered, highly motivated and focused teams. Examples of outcomes achieved to date include: creating the company’s first organisation-wide strategic plan, successfully facilitating business transformation / change strategy, significantly reduced risk profile and improved overall operational efficiency.

As a leader, I am fair, driven and focused on delivering on corporate objectives. In the last 5 years of my career in particular, I have demonstrated an innate ability to provide leadership, innovation, governance, and management required to identify, evaluate, mitigate, and monitor the company's operational and strategic risk, through the development and implementation of risk management tools, practices and policies.  With an intimate knowledge of the businesses vision, resources, processes and clients, I am able to ensure optimum compliance and deliver strategies aligned with achieving corporate goals and objectives.

Specialties: 
✔	Chief Risk Officer 
✔	Risk Management
✔	Business / Strategic Planning & Implementation
✔	Change Management
✔	Business Transformation
✔	Process Improvement
✔	Business Improvement
✔	Continuous Improvement
✔	Risk Strategy
✔	Risk Analysis
✔	Resource Management
✔	Team Leadership
✔	Team Building
✔	Program Management
✔	Program Planning 
✔	P & L Management
✔	Stakeholder Liaison
✔	Stakeholder Negotiation 
✔	Organisational Change
✔	Process Re-engineering

profile_positions.description:

Reporting to the Global Head of Rural and Retail Clients, responsible for delivery of a key global business growth initiative.

profile_positions.title: Senior Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Key Responsibilities:
●	Reporting directly to Rabobank’s CEO and leading a team of 22 multidisciplinary staff
●	Manage and oversee the establishment of a business unit responsible for strategy and its execution. This involved:
-	Strategy planning and development
-	Project delivery (PMO)
-	Process improvement (Lean Six Sigma)
-	Business transformation and organisational change management 

●	Deputy Chair of the:
-	Product Approval Committee (new product approval),
-	Project, Investment and Change Committee (governance body for investments)
-	Operational Excellence Steering Committee

Selected Achievements:
●	Developed, managed and implemented Rabobank’s first organisation-wide strategy. 
●	Championed and gained approval for the introduction of operational excellence as a core pillar of strategy – initially focussed on the introduction of Lean Six Sigma to the organisation
●	Designed a fit for purpose Enterprise Program Management Office (EPMO) to deliver oversight and assurance activity of Rabobank’s project portfolio
●	(Further details on achievements contained within CV – available upon request)

profile_positions.title: General Manager Program Office & Strategic Planning

profile_positions.description:
Key Responsibilities:
●	Reported to the RAG’s CRO, led a credit team of 63 people including 45 within Australia and 18 in New Zealand
●	Responsible for managing all aspects of credit risk (loan approvals, settlement and securities, setting and maintenance of policy and procedure) for Country Banking in Australia and New Zealand
●	Responsible for providing advice and making crucial decisions regarding lending proposals (country banking and wholesale / institutional), as a member of the RAG Credit Committee
●	Member of Rabobank’s Senior Management Team
●	Chair of the Country Banking Credit Committee (sub- committee of the RAG CC)
●	One of two Responsible Managers for RAG’s ACL

Selected Achievements:
●	Successfully completed a strategic review of Country Banking Credit, resulting in a range of groundbreaking changes designed to improve the risk management culture, environment and efficiency (in the changed environment); for example:
-	A significant improvement in the credit risk management framework
-	Creation of a Collateral Inspection function for SME floating assets  which was a key contributor to successfully managing down the risks in the portfolio, ultimately leading to reduced annual provisions; i.e. from 65bps in 2009 to 13bps in 2012 (below pre GFC levels
●	(Further achievements contained within CV – available upon request)
